definition: point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: I love their Asian desserts, particularly the hot tofu with sweet ginger sauce.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢他们的亚洲甜点，特别是甜姜汁热豆腐。

sentences.english: Are you going to have dessert?
Cheesecake is a large family of sweet, cheese-based cakes.
sentences.chinese: 芝士蛋糕是一类用芝士作为基本材料的甜点。

sentences.english: So get all sources of sweets, deserts and sugar out of your house.
sentences.chinese: 把各种各样的糖果，甜点和其他糖移出你的房间。

sentences.english: Of course, in the end these dark moments help make the happy ending feel all the sweeter.
sentences.chinese: 当然这些“杯具”最终会成为大团圆结局的甜点。

sentences.english: Marriage is a meal where the soup should be better than the dessert.
sentences.chinese: 汤比甜点心更佳的一顿饭。

sentences.english: Of course, adding a dessert and a cup of tea or coffee is also another good choice.
sentences.chinese: 味色具佳，最好加上一道甜点，以及茶式咖啡。

sentences.english: They eat soly sweet dessert that only build up fat but no nutrition.
sentences.chinese: 他们只吃使他们长脂肪而无食物价值的甜点心。

sentences.english: For desert we are having bean-ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 餐后的甜点是红豆冰沙。

sentences.english: Even a simple pasta would work; buy dessert from the bakery in the grocery store.
sentences.chinese: 还可以从食品杂货店的面包房中买一些甜点。

sentences.english: There was even cherry pie, for dessert.
sentences.chinese: 还有樱桃派做饭后的甜点。

sentences.english: Shall we have some dessert first?
sentences.chinese: 我们先来点儿甜点心好吗？

sentences.english: Peaches are widely eaten fresh and are baked in desserts.
sentences.chinese: 桃被广泛地使用于鲜食和甜点烘焙中。

sentences.english: The special dessert the hostess prepared made a tremendous hit with everyone at the party.
sentences.chinese: 女主人做的甜点心在晚会上大受欢迎。

sentences.english: Dessert menu, sir. What would you like, sir?
sentences.chinese: 这是甜点单，先生，你喜欢吃什么呢？

sentences.english: Customers eat their dessert standing up around large pillars or at the central bar.
sentences.chinese: 吃甜点站起来客户或大柱子周围中央的酒吧。

definition: macaron, French pastry with a soft filling sandwiched between the meringue-based cookie shells (loanword)
